Content_wSideColumn.BodyCopy:
In the Quest program there are Class Activities and Extracurricular Activities. They vary each year based upon availability, weather, preference, and other factors.

Class Activities:

Because the focus of Quest is on experiential learning, students participate in activities that build upon what they learn in class.

Each Quest group is different, and BYU-Idaho instructors will incorporate various learning activities in all Quest classes.

Optional Activities:

Several hours of non-class related time is devoted each week for students to participate in additional activities which focus on discovery, recreation, service, cultural events, and a variety of other optional activities.

Our Site Staff develop programs based partially on student interest and on discovery of new places and events.

Backpacking

Imagine backpacking through the Greater Yellowstone Ecosystem! As part of the recreation class, students have backpacked for three days in some of the most beautiful places in the country. Backpacking gear is provided.

Yellowstone National Park

The world’s first national park is a short drive away and has proved an outdoor laboratory for biology, geology, anthropology, and other experiences at Quest.

Canoeing

Enjoy canoeing through the most beautiful scenery in the country. Equipment provided.

Jackson Hole, WY

Most Quest groups spend a day at or near Jackson Hole. It is home to marvelous museums, art galleries, shopping, and is a gateway to Grand Teton National Park.

Rock Climbing

Feel the exhilaration of rock climbing and enjoy a view from the top! Equipment provided.

Ropes Courses

The ropes courses at Badger Creek are designed to be mentally and physically challenging. Unity and teamwork are developed through participation in these challenges, as well as a sense of personal achievement. There are a variety of different ropes courses available including a climbing tower, a cargo net, a rappelling tower, a giant swing, and a zip line.

Service Projects

Service opportunities could be small scale projects helping individual people or large scale projects including humanitarian aid. Each Quest will provide service to a group or individual.

Table Rock Hike

This flat-topped, 11,106-foot summit offers views of the many peaks of the Teton Mountains. The 13-mile round-trip hike--most of it within the Jedediah Smith Wilderness--follows the North Fork Teton Canyon Trail.

White Water Rafting

Enjoy rafting through the Snake River canyon and hitting the famous Big Kahuna and lunch counter rapids. Equipment provided.
